questions.question: The water came up ………………………………… our knees.
questions.description: Above and over can both mean higher than.

questions.question: They walked right …………………………….. the desert.
questions.description: Across means on or to the other side of a flat area or surface.

questions.question: She danced …………………………………. into the room.
questions.description: We use the adverb happily to modify the verb danced.

questions.question: I can …………………………………. recommend their service.
questions.description: Highly is similar to very much. It shows an extreme degree.

questions.question: He was ………………………………… punished for his crimes.
questions.description: Justly is the adverb for the meaning ‘in accordance with justice or the law.’

questions.question: They are ……………………………… excited about the party.
Isn’t she dressed …………………………………?
questions.description: Prettily means in a pretty way.

questions.question: She was ………………………………. asleep when the thieves broke in.
questions.description: Sound is an adverb in the expression sound asleep.

questions.question: She was sleeping ………………………………… when the thieves broke in.
She has eaten ……………………………………. the candies.
questions.description: All or all of can be used before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: He is not ……………………………….. successful as his wife.
questions.description: After not, we can use as/so…….as.

questions.question: You need not ……………………………….. woken me up.
questions.description: When need is used as a modal, it is followed by an infinitive without to.
